alert.note: Alert for Bernalillo (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 09 at 4:51PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected in the Albuquerque metro area. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central New Mexico, including the following counties, in central New Mexico, Bernalillo. In north central New Mexico, Sandoval. This includes the Albuquerque metro area. * WHEN...Until 645 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 451 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.25 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Albuquerque, Corrales, Los Ranchos De Albuquerque, North Valley, South Valley, Sandia Pueblo and Alameda. - This includes the following low water crossings... Richfield Ave and Eubank NE, Holbrook St and Alameda NE, Eagle Rock Ave NE between Tennyson and Lowell, Modesto Ave NE between Tennyson and Lowell, Glendale Ave and Browning St NE, Browning St NE between Anaheim and Corona Ave NE and Corona Ave NE between Browning and Eubank NE.
info.instruction: To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way.
